_meta.note: Test briefing packet for Phase 2 execution

committee_name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee
summary: The committee is considering provisions related to advanced energy technologies and infrastructure modernization in the NDAA FY2026. This presents opportunities for wireless power technology integration and air quality monitoring systems in defense facilities.
key_points: Section 227 addresses advanced manufacturing technologies coordination
Division B authorizes military construction projects with infrastructure modernization
Title II R&D programs include technology enhancement initiatives
Energy efficiency modifications (Section 314) align with wireless power benefits

agenda.title: Advanced Manufacturing Technologies
agenda.relevance: High - Direct alignment with wireless power manufacturing

asks: Support inclusion of wireless power technology in infrastructure modernization
Consider air quality monitoring systems for health and safety compliance
Advocate for R&D funding for advanced energy technologies
risks: Competing priorities may limit focus on specific technologies
Budget constraints may affect implementation timeline
